intro: Bryodesma wallacei, commonly known as the Wallace's bryodesma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
